trend_summary: Built-up footprints expand slowly along the main northeastâ€“southwest road, adding scattered houses and a few light-industrial roofs. Several forest blocks are cleared for rectangular fields, while existing cropland intensifies. One or two ponds appear more defined and road surfacing brightens, implying upgrades. Despite changes, the landscape stays predominantly rural and sparsely developed.
notable_changes: New dwellings and sheds infill hamlets along the primary road corridor.
Progressive clearing of northeast forest patches converts woodland to agriculture.
Rectangular field pattern enlarges, indicating intensified cropping and pasture.
Main arterial road brightens and straightens slightly, suggesting resurfacing or widening.
